item.title: Hacker News Top Stories: Tuesday, December 17, 2024 at 1:20 AM UTC
item.description:
1. Xiaomi Home Integration for Home Assistant (404 points | 207 comments)
2. Go Protobuf: The New Opaque API (162 points | 50 comments)
3. New LLM optimization technique slashes memory costs up to 75% (22 points | 6 comments)
4. Lfgss shutting down 16th March 2025 (day before Online Safety Act is enforced) (377 points | 235 comments)
5. Veo 2: Our video generation model (319 points | 151 comments)
6. Making a watch from scratch (111 points | 18 comments)
7. In Search of a Faster SQLite (199 points | 77 comments)
8. Forgotten Collection of Charles de Gaulle's Manuscripts Discovered in a Safe (27 points | 1 comment)
9. Why is it so hard to buy things that work well? (2022) (479 points | 410 comments)
10. What did Ada Lovelace's program actually do? (2018) (199 points | 63 comments)
11. Advent of Code on the Nintendo DS (25 points | 5 comments)
12. Ruby Video – On a mission to index all Ruby conferences (147 points | 13 comments)
13. Kevin Langdon's 'Omni Magazine' unsupervised IQ test (1979) (8 points | 4 comments)
14. Always go to the funeral (2005) (107 points | 51 comments)
15. Modelica (211 points | 67 comments)
16. Ask HN: SWEs how do you future-proof your career in light of LLMs? (202 points | 436 comments)
17. Popeye and Tintin enter the public domain in 2025 along with Faulkner, Hemingway (202 points | 62 comments)
18. Quick takes on the recent OpenAI public incident write-up (51 points | 11 comments)

21. Principles of Educational Programming Language Design (23 points | 19 comments)
22. Absinthe: From green fairy to moral panic (32 points | 19 comments)
23. Converge (YC S23) is hiring founding engineer #2 ( | hide)
24. Mirror bacteria research poses significant risks, scientists warn (125 points | 103 comments)
25. Backward-incompatible GRUB2 change causing BIOS setup bootloop (59 points | 11 comments)
26. Our muscles will atrophy as we climb the Kardashev Scale (92 points | 135 comments)
27. Konwinski Prize (113 points | 37 comments)
28. The higher fertility of TSMC semiconductor workers (14 points | 6 comments)
29. UK's Online Safety Act comes into force (141 points | 172 comments)
30. Images of gamma-ray flare from supermassive black hole M87 (44 points | 9 comments)
